title: Upholstery Textile, 19th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: compound plain weave
creditline: Gift of Mrs. William A. Hutcheson
description: Alternately broad and narrow stripes produced by various colors and different textures of weave. On the narrow stripes are serpentine vines with flowers. On the wider bands are ribbon-like serpentines with bouquets on either side. Pattern produced by extra warp and weft of colored silks.

tombstone.epitaph:
Upholstery Textile, 19th century.
19th century. Medium: silk
Technique: compound plain weave. Gift of Mrs. William A. Hutcheson. 1943-31-3.
